# NSColorChanging | Apple Developer Documentation

- [ AppKit ](/documentation/appkit)

- [ NSColorChanging ](/documentation/AppKit/NSColorChanging)

-  NSColorChanging 

Protocol# NSColorChanging

macOS

```
protocol NSColorChanging : NSObjectProtocol
```

## [Overview](/documentation/AppKit/NSColorChanging#Overview)

When the user selects a color in an [`NSColorPanel`](/documentation/appkit/nscolorpanel) object, the panel tries to call this method on the first responder. You can override this method in any responder that needs to respond to a color change.

## [Topics](/documentation/AppKit/NSColorChanging#topics)

### [Responding to a Color Change](/documentation/AppKit/NSColorChanging#Responding-to-a-Color-Change)

[`func changeColor(NSColorPanel?)`](/documentation/appkit/nscolorchanging/changecolor(_:))Sent to the first responder when the user selects a color in an NSColorPanel object.**Required**

## [Relationships](/documentation/AppKit/NSColorChanging#relationships)

### [Inherits From](/documentation/AppKit/NSColorChanging#inherits-from)

- [`NSObjectProtocol`](/documentation/ObjectiveC/NSObjectProtocol)

### [Conforming Types](/documentation/AppKit/NSColorChanging#conforming-types)

- [`NSTextView`](/documentation/appkit/nstextview)

## [See Also](/documentation/AppKit/NSColorChanging#see-also)

### [Responding to a color change](/documentation/AppKit/NSColorChanging#Responding-to-a-color-change)

[`class let colorDidChangeNotification: NSNotification.Name`](/documentation/appkit/nscolorpanel/colordidchangenotification)Posted when the color of the `NSColorPanel` is set, as when [`NSColorPanel`](/documentation/appkit/nscolorpanel) is invoked.
